indications: Damp-Heat Painful Urinary Dysfunction due to Damp-Heat with dark, burning and scanty urination
Damp skin disorders where itching is a main symptom (eczema, scabies) (internal and topical)

action.primary: Clears Wind-Heat affecting the eyes and head

indications: Swollen, painful eyes and head and skin disorders due to Wind-Heat

contraindications: Do not use when there are no Damp-Heat symptoms.
incompatibilities: Do not use with Os Sepiae Sepiellae #{HaiPiaoXiao} Hai Piao Xiao.

useCases: Painful urinary dysfunction due to Urinary Bladder Damp-Heat with dark, burning and scanty urination.
Skin irritation and itchiness due to Damp-Heat.
Topically, as a wash for itch.
Damp-Heat or Wind-Heat causing eczema and itching.
Urinary tract infection or Bladder infection.
Powder and apply topically for itching.

notes: Both Di Fu Zi and Rx. Sophorae Flavescentis #{KuShen} Ku Shen clear Damp-Heat, expel Wind, alleviates itching and facilitate urination. Di Fu Zi is superior at expelling Wind, resolving Dampness and alleviating itching while Ku Shen is better at clearing Damp-Heat. It is used externally to clear Heat toxin which causes itchy sores and internally it treats dysentery and jaundice due to Damp-Heat.
This herb can be used alone for urinary tract infections during pregnancy.
